titleStmt.title: Petitions against bishops and their votes in Parliament, subscrib'd unto after a clandestine, deliver'd after a tumultuous manner, and falsly going under the name of a whole county or towne, proved to be both contrary to our late taken protestation, as also utterly unlawfull by many other cleere and evident reasons. First written for satisfaction of some private men, and now published for the good of others. By J.W.
titleStmt.author: J. W.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A. N. for Richard Lownds, at his shop adjoying to Ludgate,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
